intro: Hypocalymma cuneatum, commonly known as the Narrow-leaved Bushwillow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with woody stems and elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually greenish-white and are followed by small, round fruits that contain a single seed. Hypocalymma cuneatum is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
